meleeWeapons.name: 1d4 melee weapon
meleeWeapons.description: Examples: Pocket Knife, Broken Bottle, Brass Knuckles

meleeWeapons.name: 1d6 melee weapon
meleeWeapons.description: Examples: Lead Pipe, Hammer, Hatchet, Ka-Bar, WW2 Trench Knife, Replica Katana

meleeWeapons.name: 1d8 melee weapon
meleeWeapons.description: Examples: Machete, Fire Axe, Crowbar, Combat Baton

meleeWeapons.name: 1d10 melee weapon (two-handed)
meleeWeapons.description: Examples: Baseball Bat, Wood Axe, Sledgehammer

meleeWeapons.name: 1d12 melee weapon (two-handed)
meleeWeapons.description: Examples: Claymore, Heavy Fire Axe, Large Maul

meleeWeapons.name: Chainsaw (Running)
meleeWeapons.description: Deals 1d12 slashing damage; requires fuel; two-handed.

archaicWeapons.name: Reserve Bow
archaicWeapons.description: Energy Blast (Piercing): 10 (1d6/6), reload after each shot.

firearms.name: AR-15
firearms.description: Standard Issue Assault Rifle; Spray/Burst; 20 rounds.

armor.name: Leather Jacket
armor.description: Provides light protection, DR 1 vs melee only.

armor.name: Riot Gear
armor.description: Provides DR 3 vs all physical damage, but imposes disadvantage on Dexterity checks.

armor.name: Tactical Body Armor
armor.description: Tactical Body Armor (DR vs. Physical 3/Energy 2/Ballistic 6, Bulk: 1). Commonly used by the military and specialized law enforcement, consisting of ballistic vests and reinforced clothing, including knee and elbow pads.

armor.name: Reinforced Clothing
armor.description: Reinforced Clothing (DR vs. Physical 2/Energy 2, Bulk: 0). Made of Newtonian fibers, granting balanced protection against many attack forms.

armor.name: Ballistic Vest
armor.description: Ballistic Vest (DR vs. Physical 1/ Ballistic 6, Bulk: 0). Standard Kevlar vest, effective against ballistic attacks.

armor.name: Boiled Leather Armor
armor.description: Boiled Leather Armor (DR vs. Physical 3/Energy 0, Bulk: 1). Molded cow leather; grants additional Bulk if not custom-fitted.

armor.name: Chain Mail
armor.description: Chain Mail (DR vs. Physical 4/Energy 1, Bulk: 2). Armor made from linked steel rings or coiled leather, soldered together.

armor.name: Heavy Clothing
armor.description: Heavy Clothing (DR vs. Physical 2/Energy 0, Bulk: 0). Includes heavy coats or sports padding. Can be worn with a ballistic vest, but adds 1 Bulk.

armor.name: Riot Shield
armor.description: Riot Shield: +1 Avoidance, MS: 12, Hits: 2. Made of transparent reinforced Plexiglas.

armor.name: Shield
armor.description: Shield: +1 Avoidance, MS: 20, Hits: 6. Made of reinforced wood or steel.

armor.name: Boiled Leather Armor
armor.description: DR: 3 Phys; Bulk: 1 (extra Bulk if not custom-fit)

equipment.name: Standard First Aid Kit
equipment.description: These are the standard first aid kits found in most homes and the trunks of high-end cars and occasional jeep. While this kit does not grant a bonus to a Hero’s Medicine Skill Checks, it is considered to be the right tool for the right job and, as such, negates any relevant penalties.

equipment.name: EMT Medical Field Kit
equipment.description: A larger kit, commonly carried in a modified tool/tackle box, these kits come with a large variety of bandages, pain relievers, antibiotic packages, instant ice packs, and some basic surgical tools. Any Hero utilizing this kit gains a +2 bonus to all Medicine Skill Checks. If a Hero is being treated for a disease or attempting to recover Wounds while being treated with this kit, they gain a +1 bonus to their Constitution Ability Checks.

equipment.name: Tactical Response Pack
equipment.description: Standard military backpack. These kits are highly sought after, packed with everything found in the EMT Medical Field Kit (just more of it) as well as Ammonia inhalants, liquid bandages, trauma dressings, and emergency surgical tools. Any Hero utilizing this kit gains a +3 bonus to all Medicine Skill Checks. If a Hero is being treated for a disease or attempting to recover Wounds while being treated with this kit, they gain a +2 bonus to their Constitution Ability Checks

equipment.name: Full Medical Response Pack
equipment.description: Also known as a portable hospital, these packs are extremely rare, limited to military, police, emergency response units, and the occasional survival nut. These packs come with everything found in both the Tactical Response Pack and EMT Medical Field kits (just more of it), as well as CPR Masks, blood pressure kits, cervical collars, blood clotting spray, burn spray, and so on. Mere rumors of small stockpiles of these packs have led more than one Hero to their deaths. Any Hero utilizing this kit gains a +5 bonus to all Medicine Skill Checks. If a Hero is being treated for disease or attempting to recover Wounds while being treated with this kit they gain a +3 bonus to their Constitution Ability Checks.

equipment.name: Multi-tool
equipment.description: Portable tool kit for basic mechanical and electrical work.

equipment.name: Flashlight
equipment.description: These LED flashlights provide about 60 hours of continuous life on a set of new batteries. They provide 2 areas of directional bright light and 2 area of shadowy light beyond that.

equipment.name: Rope (50ft)
equipment.description: Durable nylon rope. Useful for climbing, traps, or securing.

equipment.name: Water Filter
equipment.description: Removes bacteria and viruses from untreated water sources.

equipment.name: Gas Mask
equipment.description: Gas Masks provide the wearer with Life Support: 20 (+5), but only against gas attacks. These masks have filters which need to be cleaned out after every use.

equipment.name: Backpack
equipment.description: Coming in various sizes and styles backpacks can commonly hold about 10 items of regular gear comfortably, while a tactical backpack with a molle system can store 14 items.

equipment.name: Batteryless “shake” Flashlight
equipment.description: These provide light for 3 rounds, requiring an action to charge it. These flashlights provide 2 areas of directional bright light and 2 areas of shadowy light beyond that.

equipment.name: Binoculars
equipment.description: Binoculars grant the user the equivalent of Super Sense (Telescopic Vision): 26 (+8) and require both hands to use properly.

equipment.name: Binoculars (Night Vision)
equipment.description: This works just like standard Binoculars, but they also grant the user Super Sense (Night Vision): 26 (+8) as well. Night vision requires 6 AA batteries lasting for 6 hours of continuous use.

equipment.name: Bivouac Sack (1 man tent)
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Canteen
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Climbing Kit
equipment.description: These kits consist of hammer, pitons, and hooks, granting the user a +2 bonus to all Athletics: (Climbing) checks.

equipment.name: Compass
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Duct Tape
equipment.description: Perhaps the most useful piece of equipment, new, sealed rolls of Duct tape are highly sought after. Duct Tape possesses an effective Strength: 14 (+2) when used to tape things up.

equipment.name: Field Kit
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Fire Extinguisher
equipment.description: Fire Extinguishers require two consecutive Demanding actions to use, snuffing out fire in a single area. After emptied, an Extinguisher is worthless, except possibly as a club.

equipment.name: Firearm Maintenance Kit
equipment.description: This kit grants a Hero a +2 bonus on all Engineering/Firearms Skill Checks when attempting to repair a jammed firearm.

equipment.name: Flint and striker
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Grappling hook
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Hand held GPS, Civilian
equipment.description: A common GPS can assist someone within 10 areas of their intended location. GPS satellites may drift off orbit.

equipment.name: Hand held GPS, Military
equipment.description: Military grade GPS’s are still very accurate. They may be used to navigate to within 1 area of any location on the planet.

equipment.name: Handsets, 2-Way Radio, Walkie-Talkie
equipment.description: Possessing a battery life of 5 hours and an effective range of 1 mile, these radios are effective though battery-dependent.

equipment.name: Lantern – Solar, Battery, Gas
equipment.description: Solar and battery lanterns require a Simple action to turn on, while Gas lanterns require two Demanding actions and a fire source. Lanterns provide bright light to the area and shadowy light to 2 adjacent areas.

equipment.name: Lock Picks
equipment.description: These picks grant the user a +2 bonus on all Larceny Skill Checks to open mechanical locks.

equipment.name: Maps
equipment.description: Detailed maps and a compass help navigate to any location on the map, sometimes granting bonuses on Survival or Local Knowledge rolls.

equipment.name: Rope (Hemp) 30’
equipment.description: Standard rope has an effective Strength of 16(+3).

equipment.name: Rope (Kevlar) 30’
equipment.description: Kevlar rope has an effective Strength of 22 (+6).

equipment.name: Rope (Nylon) 30’
equipment.description: Nylon rope has an effective strength of 20 (+4).

equipment.name: Rucksack
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Sleeping Bag
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Solar/Crank radio
equipment.description: These radios have a range of 10 miles but rarely pick up any signals.

equipment.name: Tent
equipment.description: See gear rules for details.

equipment.name: Tool Kit, Partial
equipment.description: Grants a +1 bonus on all Skill Checks when performing repairs.

equipment.name: Tool Kit, Complete
equipment.description: Grants a +2 bonus on all Skill Checks when performing repairs.

equipment.name: Water Filtration Kit
equipment.description: Removes bacteria and viruses from untreated water sources.

equipment.name: EMT Medical Field Kit
equipment.description: Grants +2 to Medicine checks and +1 to Constitution checks for healing.

equipment.name: Tactical Response Pack
equipment.description: Grants +3 to Medicine checks and +2 to Constitution checks for healing.

equipment.name: Full Medical Response Pack
equipment.description: Grants +5 to Medicine checks and +3 to Constitution checks for healing.

equipment.name: Batteryless Shake Flashlight
equipment.description: Provides 2 areas of light for 3 rounds; must be recharged with an action.

equipment.name: Binoculars (Night Vision)
equipment.description: Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 26 (+8); 6-hour battery life.

equipment.name: Firearm Maintenance Kit
equipment.description: Grants +2 to Engineering: Firearms checks to fix jams.

equipment.name: Flint and Striker
equipment.description: Reliable fire starting tool in any weather.

equipment.name: Gas Mask
equipment.description: Grants Life Support: 20 (+5) vs gas attacks. Requires filter cleanup after use.

equipment.name: Hand Held GPS (Civilian)
equipment.description: Accurate within 10 areas of target location.

equipment.name: Hand Held GPS (Military)
equipment.description: Accurate within 1 area of target location.

equipment.name: Lantern – Solar, Battery, or Gas
equipment.description: Illuminates 1 area brightly and 2 adjacent areas dimly.

equipment.name: Solar/Crank Radio
equipment.description: 10-mile range; crank or solar powered; rarely picks up signal.

equipment.name: Tool Kit, Partial
equipment.description: Grants +1 to repair-related skill checks.

equipment.name: Tool Kit, Complete
equipment.description: Grants +2 to repair-related skill checks.

equipment.name: Water Filtration Kit
equipment.description: Purifies contaminated water; vital for survival.

goBags.name: Survivalist Go-Bag
goBags.description: Focused on long-term survival with water purification and navigation tools.
items: 3 Liter Hand Powered UV Water Purifier (8,000 water treatments)
EMT Medical Field First Aid kit (4 uses left)

goBags.name: Infiltrator Go-Bag
goBags.description: Tactical gear focused on stealth, observation, and combat operations.
items: Night scope and scope mount OR Laser sight and mount OR Pocket Lock Pick Set
Tactical Holster Vest OR Tactical Sheath Utility Belt
1 clip/magazine of ammo OR 2 Hand Grenades

goBags.name: Technician Go-Bag
goBags.description: Essential tools for repairs, electrical work, and mechanical maintenance.
items: 100-Piece Mechanics Tool Kit missing 25 pieces OR 100-Piece Home Essential Tool Kit missing 25 pieces
Small solar power charger with battery
Old phone with 32GB of movies, music and apps

goBags.name: Medic Go-Bag
goBags.description: Medical supplies and emergency response equipment for treating injuries.
items: 1 Liter Hand Powered UV Water Purifier (8,000 water treatments)

goBags.name: Bystander Go-Bag
goBags.description: Basic survival essentials for someone caught unprepared.
items: 3 Liter Hand Powered UV Water Purifier (8,000 water treatments)

goBags.name: Survivalist Go-Bag
goBags.description: Includes: Water-resistant backpack, shake flashlight, bivouac sack, UV water purifier (3L), EMT first aid kit, compass or GPS, 7-day ration, flare gun, fishing rod.

goBags.name: Infiltrator Go-Bag
goBags.description: Includes: Tactical pack, scope or laser sight or lockpick set, NV binoculars, holster or utility belt, ammo or 2 grenades, climbing kit, gas mask, throat communicators, radio, gloves.

goBags.name: Technician Go-Bag
goBags.description: Includes: Utility belt, shake flashlight, 2-way radio, jump starter, partial mechanics or tool kit, gloves, multi-tool, solar charger, old phone with media.

goBags.name: Medic Go-Bag
goBags.description: Includes: High-capacity duffle, tactical response pack, litter, flare gun, 3 ration packs, UV water purifier (1L), climber’s kit, light sticks, folding knife.

goBags.name: Bystander Go-Bag
goBags.description: Includes: Water-resistant backpack, 7 ration packs, UV water purifier (3L), compass or GPS, standard first aid kit, bivouac sack, light sticks, climber’s kit, multi-tool.

tacticalAccessory.name: Tactical Rail System
tacticalAccessory.description: Allows mounting of flashlight, laser sight, or scope on firearms. Frees up one hand.

tacticalAccessory.name: Tactical Flashlight
tacticalAccessory.description: Mountable flashlight providing bright light up to 2 areas and shadowy light beyond. 40 hours battery life.

tacticalAccessory.name: Tactical Laser Point Sight
tacticalAccessory.description: +1 to hit within 3 areas. Trigger pad activated. Battery lasts ~2 months with sparing use.

tacticalAccessory.name: Silencer
tacticalAccessory.description: Usable on light/medium/assault firearms. Reduces noise; DC 20 Perception (Hearing) to detect.

tacticalSight.name: Tactical Dot Sight
tacticalSight.description: +1 to hit within 2 areas. Mountable with rail system.

tacticalSight.name: Standard Hunting Scope
tacticalSight.description: Extends range up to 10 areas. Mountable on rifles, does not require rail.

tacticalSight.name: Tactical Sniper Scope
tacticalSight.description: Extends range up to 20 areas. Requires tactical rail.

tacticalSight.name: Night Vision Sight
tacticalSight.description: Extends range to 10 areas. Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 20 (+5) for 3 hours.

optics.name: Simple Night Vision Goggles
optics.description: Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 14 (+2) for 8 hours continuous use.

optics.name: Tactical Night Vision Goggles
optics.description: Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 20 (+5) for 12 hours continuous use.

optics.name: Tactical Dot Sight
optics.description: Provides +1 to hit within 2 areas; requires rail system.

optics.name: Standard Hunting Scope
optics.description: Grants Extended Range up to 10 areas.

optics.name: Tactical Sniper Scope
optics.description: Grants Extended Range up to 20 areas; requires rail system.

optics.name: Night Vision Sight
optics.description: Grants Extended Range (10) and Super Sense (Night Vision): 20 (+5) for 3 hours.

optics.name: Simple Night Vision Goggles
optics.description: Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 14 (+2) for 8 hours.

optics.name: Tactical Night Vision Goggles
optics.description: Grants Super Sense (Night Vision): 20 (+5) for 12 hours.

otherModernWeapons.name: Grenade Launcher
otherModernWeapons.description: Shoulder-fired weapon launching grenades (Concussion, Fragmentation, etc.) up to 10 areas. Requires appropriate grenade rounds to fire.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flare Gun
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Blast (Fire) 14, 1d8 fire damage, 7 area range, bright/dim light for 10/10 areas. DC 15 Dex save or target is engulfed in flames.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flamethrower
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Blast (Fire) 24, 1d12 fire damage, 6 area range. DC 15 Dex save or engulfed in flames. 5 shots per load. Reduced range/damage with standard fuel.

otherModernWeapons.name: Stun Gun/Taser
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Blast (Electrical) 24, 1d12 electric damage, 1 area. DC 15 Con save or target falls prone and is stunned until end of next turn.

otherModernWeapons.name: Fragmentation Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Explosion (Kinetic/Piercing): 30. 1d6 Kinetic + 1d6 Piercing damage in area.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flashbang Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: DC 20 Con save or stunned until end of next turn. No effect on zombies. Attracts zombies.

otherModernWeapons.name: Concussion Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Explosion (Kinetic): 20. 1d10 Kinetic damage. DC 15 Con save or knocked prone and stunned.

otherModernWeapons.name: Corrosive Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Explosion (Acid): 24. 1d12 Acid damage and target is engulfed in acid.

otherModernWeapons.name: Incendiary Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Explosion (Fire): 24. 1d12 Fire damage. Targets are engulfed in flames.

otherModernWeapons.name: Tear-Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: DC 20 Con save or become blinded and stunned. No effect on zombies.

otherModernWeapons.name: Knock-Out Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: DC 15 Con save or fall unconscious. Repeat saves each turn. No effect on zombies.

otherModernWeapons.name: Poison Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Poison 20. DC 20 Con save or become poisoned. Repeat saves each turn. No effect on zombies.

otherModernWeapons.name: Smoke Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Creates Darkness 20 in affected area, severely limiting visibility.

otherModernWeapons.name: Molotov
otherModernWeapons.description: Energy Explosion (Fire): 20. 1d10 Fire damage. DC 15 Dex save or engulfed in flames.

otherModernWeapons.name: Grenade Launcher
otherModernWeapons.description: Fires grenades over 10 areas; requires grenade ammo.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flare Gun
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d8 fire damage; lights up areas; may ignite targets.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flamethrower
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d12 fire damage, 6-area range, 5 shots; ignites targets.

otherModernWeapons.name: Stun Gun/Taser
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d12 electric; may stun or knock prone.

otherModernWeapons.name: Fragmentation Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d6 kinetic + 1d6 piercing to all in area.

otherModernWeapons.name: Flashbang Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Stuns all in area unless DC 20 Constitution save.

otherModernWeapons.name: Concussion Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d10 kinetic + DC 15 Con save or stunned + prone.

otherModernWeapons.name: Corrosive Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d12 acid damage; may engulf targets in acid.

otherModernWeapons.name: Incendiary Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d12 fire damage; ignites targets.

otherModernWeapons.name: Tear-Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Blinds and stuns unless DC 20 Constitution save.

otherModernWeapons.name: Knock-Out Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Unconscious unless DC 15 Constitution save.

otherModernWeapons.name: Poison Gas Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Poisoned unless DC 20 Constitution save.

otherModernWeapons.name: Smoke Grenade
otherModernWeapons.description: Creates Darkness: 20 in target area.

otherModernWeapons.name: Molotov Cocktail
otherModernWeapons.description: 1d10 fire; DC 15 Dex save or ignite target.
